metadata.title: CVE-2024-44185 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in tvOS17.6, visionOS 1.3, Safari 17.6, watchOS 10.6, iOS 17.6 and iPadOS 17.6,macOS Sonoma 14.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead toan unexpected process crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-44185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-bin - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
webkitgtk-webdriver - 2.46.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.46.1-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
